1124358269965758464.text: Great chat everyone. Thanks Jason, @Startup_Canada and all who joined! #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124357990197465089 …

1124356993668370432.text: A11: Start with a written plan: a plan and projections are key to securing funding. Reach out to your network including angel investors, family, friends etc. Build relationships and seek out advisors. Learn how credit works.  Ask questions when you don’t know. #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124356725115637760 …

1124355669044285446.text: A10: It’s vital to research, prepare and plan. Take the time to understand the needs of the business. Get the right advice from the right people – reach out if you need help. Solid business knowledge and a comprehensive plan can help identify needs for funding. #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124355471115194368 …

1124354493980729344.text: A9(2/2): Be sure not to over-borrow and keep business and personal separate. Ensure you start with a solid business plan with realistic projections. Build strong relationships with a team of advisors for support and guidance. #StartupChats

1124354413429051392.text: A9(1/2): There’s a risk of losing all equity and any collateral used to secure a loan if the business fails. The bank will first renegotiate the terms to develop a working solution. If after all efforts the loan defaults, it is forwarded to collections dept. #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124354210940760064 …

1124353235647483905.text: A8(2/2): Series A,B,C,D,E are subsequent rounds where the company generates additional cash usually through VCs by further diluting the earnings. Funding for each series can be different depending which life cycle phase the company is going through. #StartupChats

1124353162070986754.text: A8(1/2): Equity financing is when stake in the co. is offered in return for cash. Seed funding is a form of securities offering in which an investor provides capital in a startup in exchange for an equity stake in the co. usually done by angel investors. #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124352955497500672 …

1124352014719127552.text: A7: Business LOCs are useful when there’s a need to access cash for short term, like financing account receivables, purchasing seasonal inventory or operating expense shortfalls.  It provides the business with flexibility to access funds whenever it’s needed. #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124351682513649664 …

1124351497406255109.text: Just under 30 minutes left in the live chat with @Scotiabank’s Jason Charlebois on borrowing & funding for your startup! Join us using #StartupChats

1124350777881841667.text:
A6: CSBFP is a good place to start & could help the new business dramatically. http://bit.ly/2ZKFozX  

Also look at programs for special industries like the Canadian Agricultural Loan Act CSLA. Take the time to research as programs & funding are always changing. #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124350515385651200 …

1124349458601234433.text: A5(2/2): If there’s no prior business activity, banks will look to personal history. Before applying for a loan, establish a plan and, know what your financial needs and projections are. #StartupChats

1124349370248228865.text: A5(1/2): Many factors are considered including: purpose of loan, type of business, relationship with the bank, good business plan, repayment history, business / personal credit score / available collateral / debt-to-income ratio. #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124349176521928704 …

1124348394757967872.text: A4(2/2): A banker can help with key decisions including how to prepare funding requests and applying for short term solutions like a line of credit as operations ramp up. #StartupChats

1124348316446158848.text: A4(1/2): Start with a business plan to establish operating expenses and revenue generation. Ideally a business should be able to afford its expenses by generating enough cash from its operations. Establish a relationship with a business banker to help review plans. #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124347921208696833 …

1124346846527102982.text: A3: Determine all initial expenses: fixed costs + working capital needs, then the money you have available. The funds required to start is the difference between the two. Some funds can have very high interest rates (private loans) and should likely be turned down. #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124346668743299072 …

1124345648457760768.text: A2: Government grants and programs are a great place to start. Banks can offer term loans and welcome programs to help new businesses. They also offer business lines of credit and business credit cards. #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124345414356996096 …

1124344399469486080.text: A1: When starting up, funding can come from many sources including: personal funds, parents, friends & family, venture capital, angel investors, government grants & programs, BDC and bank loans. #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124344159517777922 …

1124342645990383617.text: Join Jason Charlebois, Senior Vice-President, Small Business Banking, for a live chat all about borrowing & funding for your startup! Use #StartupChats to participate. @Startup_Canadahttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1124341643774177281 …

1060955177337872385.text: Great chat everyone. Thanks Jason, @Startup_Canada and all who joined. #StartupChats

1060954138589253632.text:
Listen then act, be open to change, learn & stay on top of the regulations! ^JC 

@Startup_Canada | #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1060953954337603585 …

1060952804204908544.text:
Learn as much as you can! Learn from others, research the location (demographics, consumer behaviours, etc.), consider local partnerships & scaling operations. Also consider test & learns & include site visits in your plans. ^JC 

@Startup_Canada | #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1060952694511337473 …

1060951631733383168.text:
Experts include industry veterans who have already gone through the process, lawyers, accountants, consultants (public & private) & end consumers of your product/service. ^JC 

@Startup_Canada | #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1060951436928925697 …

1060950302977875968.text:
Customs brokers are a part of the process in helping to bring goods across the border. They manage the paperwork, rules & regulations. They can be a great resource to share trends & best practices. ^JC 

@Startup_Canada | #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1060950173818470400 …

1060949114114990083.text:
Visit the EDC website for country info & solutions and look to community groups to support you. Also, don’t underestimate the value of a site visit to the country you’re looking to work with. ^JC 

@Startup_Canada | #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1060948910150168576 …

1060947911289290757.text:
Global opportunities are constantly changing. Stay up to date on trends & preferences. Historically Canada has had a great reputation for its unique & niche products/services. ^JC 

@Startup_Canada | #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1060947776064905222 …

1060947628815536133.text: Just 30 minutes left in the live chat with @Scotiabank’s Jason Charlebois on taking a startup international. Join us using #StartupChats.

1060946555392409601.text:
Talk to peers to learn from their experiences, reach out to local & foreign agencies including the EDC for resources & support. Don’t discount testing & learning – starting small & scaling can provide great value. ^JC

@Startup_Canada | #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1060946397380403200 …

1060945452856762373.text:
Have a plan, consider the business structure & how you want to grow before taking it overseas. Opening Foreign branches vs establishing affiliates can impact foreign taxation. Consult a tax expert for advice to help avoid layers of taxation. ^JC 

@Startup_Canada | #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1060945136518160384 …

1060944092983631873.text:
Barriers & challenges include: shipping; regulations; currency fluctuations; taxes/tariffs; cultural differences & consumer needs for protection from fraud. ^JC 
 
@Startup_Canada | #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1060943907964534784 …

1060942865805783040.text:
Search is the ultimate global platform & having a website at minimum is mandatory. Use social media to draw interest, consider language (toggles) & cultural sensitivities (neutrality). ^JC 

@Startup_Canada | #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1060942639057551360 …

1060941719741648897.text:
Expanding globally depends on the business model, structure of the business, industry & product/service. Global opportunities can help turn a niche market into a thriving business by expanding its reach. ^JC 

@Startup_Canada | #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1060941378400780288 …

For more info on Scotiabank’s business banking services, please visit http://scotiabank.com .

1042457296478109696.text: Think of your banker as a part of your support team. Keep them informed of changes in your biz so they can provide the best guidance for you & your biz. Take advantage of the available info & self-serve capabilities online & enjoy the ride! ^JC @Startup_Canada #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1042457075559923712 …

1042456218739068929.text: Banks provide biz owners with more online capabilities that reduce costs like mobile cheque deposits. Online banking makes accessing funds, payments etc. much easier. Access to virtual advisors and authenticating safely 24/7 are others. ^JC @Startup_Canada #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1042455826693345280 …

1042456038774124545.text: All businesses should consider an operating account, saving management, and potential lending needs. Your advisor is your best resource to discuss your banking needs. ^JC @Startup_Canada #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1042454572827070464 …

1042453777851269121.text: Talk to one of our Advisors to review your biz. It’s free & can help identify cost & time savings like no fee CCs & online capabilities, so you can focus on customers. Use digital services and watch out for freebies that cost more in the long run ^JC @Startup_Canada #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1042453301529403392 …

1042452417042886658.text: One bank is recommended as it has a more holistic view and can provide relevant solutions. One bank makes it easier to access funds, manage accnts, & simplifies banking. The bank can help keep your financials in order while you focus on your biz. ^JC @Startup_Canada #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1042452049835819011 …

1042451189642788865.text: There are many different types of cards w/ different rewards. Holding CCs from multiple FIs could affect credit rating & approvals on future loans. Consider reconciliation & rewards collection when using more than one card. ^JC @Startup_Canada #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1042450914211246081 …

1042450748443901953.text: Just 30 minutes left in the live chat with @Scotiabank’s Jason Charlebois on building a business banking package. Join us using #StartupChats.

1042449762950238208.text: This is a personal choice. The advantage for using the same bank is that they have a holistic view and can address all your financial needs at once. Maintaining one bank provides ease of access to funds, account mgmt & convenience. ^JC @Startup_Canada #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1042449533974847489 …

1042448497000235008.text: Benefits include receiving more holistic advice & solutions tailored to unique biz needs. SB owners w/ packages tend to have stronger relationships with their advisors, reducing friction points in daily operations. ^JC @Startup_Canada #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1042448268540686338 …

1042447343315034118.text: SB banking packages should enable daily biz operations. They should include operating accounts, borrowing solutions, savings/investments & protection options. We also provide robust payment services & add’tl partner offers. ^JC @Startup_Canada #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1042447062141468675 …

1042446035858202624.text: Right from the start! Your bank should always be aware of what’s happening in your biz. Think about all changes that your business is going through like expansions, winning contracts, etc. & consider annual reviews for continued support. ^JC @Startup_Canada #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1042445778252390401 …

1042444744708841473.text: Building relationships enables banks to provide more relevant & meaningful advice for your startup. A deeper understanding of your business also allows the banks to better support future financing needs. ^JC @Startup_Canada #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/1042444528232345601 …

997512458632876033.text: Debt-service ratio (DSR) measures your biz’s ability to repay debts based on net positive cash flow. The ratio compares net operating income (NOI) to annual debt. 997511208700964865.text: CF cycle is the time & process from initial spending for materials/services to receiving pmt for biz products/services. 977228577753231360.text: Great chat everyone. Thanks Laurent, @Startup_Canada and all who joined. #StartupChats

977227649251725312.text: Research before borrowing & understand your biz financial situation; Set-up pre-auth. payments; Create a biz plan you can refer to, to keep you on track to meet biz goals & anticipate credit needs. Try our Scotiabank Plan Writer: https://apps.scotiabank.com/planWriter/en/#section-0 … ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/977227262079782913 …

977226286161649664.text: Find out why. If it’s due to poor credit, request a copy of your report to ensure items are paid/ settled & look for a guarantor w/ good credit. Consider pledging personal assets, apply for gov’t guarantee programs/grants & start saving. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/977225998075858946 …

977225343487696897.text: Good credit will allow your biz to obtain funds to help finance growth (add more/new resources). It can help manage cash flow needs without dipping into personal savings. Good credit is also rewarded with more favourable rates. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/977224755253317632 …

977223794833149952.text: Biz registration will determine separation of personal and biz credit. Sole proprietors cannot separate biz from personal credit, whereas incorporated biz’s can apply for credit in the biz name. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/977223485599690752 …

977222639700905985.text: Discuss a repayment plan with your banker. It’s critical to understand the reason for non-repayment & ensure loans are paid on time as per the credit agreement. If receivables take too long, you may qualify for a LOC to bridge the gap. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/977222218877980677 …

977221765721133057.text: Credit is used for credit applications. After gathering all info to completely understand the biz, lenders refer to the 5C’s of credit to ensure the request makes sense for the customer & presents the most appropriate debt solution. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/977221071882596355 …

977220104252518401.text: Merchants (like Chase) allow your biz to accept credit card & debit payments. Service costs vary but are usually based on a % of each transaction. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/977219706590556160 …

977218850050723842.text: Slow repayment history (delinquent/non-payments) & credit utilization (maxing out credit for extended periods of time) can lower scores. To fix a low score pay all lenders on time & don’t continuously apply for credit. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/977218458998976512 …

977217655001309184.text: Credit reports include your credit score, all lending facilities (incl. mortgages), amount of each facility, repayment history, who has looked at your credit, your age, address & employer. The key term to understand is your credit risk score. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/977217213219442688 …

977216342213394432.text: Review your credit scores from CB providers (Trans Union/ Equifax) regularly. Paying all commitments as agreed & not maxing out all your facilities will help to ensure credit remains strong. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/977215952839434240 …

977215073344159745.text: Biz & company credit helps finance short/medium/long term goals. Determined by the 5C’s of credit: Character (credit score); Capacity (affordability); Collateral (security pledged); Conditions (marketplace); Capital (equity invested) ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/977214697106821121 …

933394970526060545.text: Great chat everyone. Thanks Laurent, @Startup_Canada and all who joined. #StartupChats

933393784355901461.text: A11 @Startup_Canada Solicit professional advice from your banker, accountant & lawyer. Also check out online resources available to entrepreneurs ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/933393421531860993 …

933392491822436352.text: A10 @Startup_Canada A biz may look to incur additional operational debt to finance primary activities, if higher profits are expected. Complete a ROI analysis to ensure additional operational debt is right for your biz^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/933392172774248449 …

933391406172901377.text: A9 @Startup_Canada Risks: premature growth, improper staffing & capacity concerns. Ensure the biz is truly in the growth phase, recruit addt’l talent you trust & can delegate to (don’t fall trap to micromanaging) & automate as many processes as possible ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/933390932275286016 …

933389990884757505.text: A8 @Startup_Canada Time to scale varies for each biz. Instead focus on the strategy & effort req. to successfully scale. Identify highest payoff aspects, seek reputable partners & develop a long-term plan. The owner of the biz function should drive scaling ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/933389663007625216 …

933388737853214724.text: A7 @Startup_Canada Avoid accumulating operational debt & prioritize costs based on biz priority (i.e. to increase sales focus spend on sales & marketing vs. product enhancements). Also consider scaling based on logistics, internal processes & systems ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/933388401914667013 …

933387950884343808.text: A6 @Startup_Canada Automation technology helps to better create efficiencies, highlight areas of improvement & enable greater customer insights. It can streamline customer support (i.e. FAQs, chatbots), assist w/ order tracking & make payments easier ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/933387229107539970 …

933387195595059200.text: Just 30 minutes left with @Scotiabank’s Laurent Mareschal discussing scaling your startup. Join us using #StartupChats!

933386236311560192.text: A5 @Startup_Canada Form a dedicated team to develop training programs for new/ existing employees & set up a performance management framework to ensure policies & procedures are understood by all employees ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/933385887819452416 …

933384916435423235.text: A4 @Startup_Canada Any part of the biz can be scaled (sales, staff, marketing, etc.). Scaling involves identifying parts of the biz you can replicate quickly & doing it more cost effectively (i.e. sell online vs brick and mortar store) ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/933384626059571201 …

933383668399263745.text: A3 @Startup_Canada First identify the amount needed & look for free money through Gov’t grants & incentives. Also consider a funding mix consisting of: personal network (family/friends/ biz partners); Equity (seek investors/ angels) & Debt (banks/ FIs) ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/933383390379814918 …

933382500474392577.text: A2 @Startup_Canada Identify biz gaps & opportunities to scale, identify potential issues & create a mitigation plan, determine solutions to implement, complete a cost/outcome exercise, implement the solutions, test and check/update ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/933382126732480513 …

933381250408165377.text: A1 @Startup_Canada Scaling is right when the biz is truly thriving (i.e. growth phase). Consider scaling if you notice customers find you instead of vice versa, you need to take on more work to keep up w/ demand & you don’t have capacity ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/933380883612041216 …

918150825440108544.text: A5 (1/2) @Startup_Canada All capital needed to legally & operationally setup the biz before product/service goes to market ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/918150485571461121 …

918149580855922688.text: A4 (1/2) @Startup_Canada RESEARCH: search online, yellow pages, read local & industry specific magazines, survey customers ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/918149243529031681 …

875034224713232384.text: A11 (2/2) @Startup_Canada Plan for the unforeseeable & practice good communication to identify risk factors early ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875033902762655746 …

875034169813991424.text: A11 (1/2) @Startup_Canada Establishing an effective risk management strategy is critical to your biz’s success ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875033902762655746 …

875033076224675840.text: A10 (2/2) @Startup_Canada It also helps to differentiate offerings & support potential expansion into new territories ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875032660837625857 …

875032958826139648.text: A10 (1/2) @Startup_Canada Similar to protecting IP & prevents competition from using & selling your products/services ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875032660837625857 …

875031868911083522.text: A9 @Startup_Canada Not all risks are insurable. For ones that are, insurance can provide financial stability. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875031434095972353 …

875030567452127232.text: A8 (2/2) @Startup_Canada Examine security logs (detect). Backup data and install patches & update regularly (correct) ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875030145660223492 …

875030485088567296.text: A8 (1/2) @Startup_Canada Use preventative/detective/corrective practices to curb attacks. Secure passwords (prevent) ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875030145660223492 …

875029216978403330.text: A7 @StartupChats_Canada Always – it’s crucial to have proper legal advice from the start. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875028868196950016 …

875028141844156416.text: A6 @StartupChats_Canada This varies based on biz structure, size, industry, shareholder agreements & financing terms ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875027785517019136 …

875027649906790401.text: Just 30 min left with @Scotiabank’s Laurent Mareschal discussing how to protect your startup from risk. Join us using #StartupChats

875026782755442697.text: A5 @StartupChats_Canada IP should always be protected & from the start. We recommend connecting with an IP lawyer. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875026350675021828 …

875025565341888512.text: A4 (2/2) @StartupChats_Canada Consider all sections of the biz plan. Once categorized, focus on key risks & create a plan ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875025123966939136 …

875025505162059776.text: A4 (1/2) @StartupChats_Canada Leverage the biz plan to identify risks & classify them based on impact to the biz ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875025123966939136 …

875024422792568833.text: A3 (2/2) @StartupChats_Canada Develop strategies to avoid/mitigate risks that are flexible when risk becomes unacceptable ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875023914480611329 …

875024340454166533.text: A3 (1/2) @StartupChats_Canada Create a risk management model that identifies sources of risk & understand the biz impact. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875023914480611329 …

875023201717411840.text: A2 (2/2) @StartupChats_Canada Changing demands, bad relations & catastrophic events (fire, etc) also impact biz success ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875022636413222912 …

875023140686049285.text: A2 (1/2) @StartupChats_Canada This depends on the owner’s knowledge level. Unforeseen risks may include financial costs. ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875022636413222912 …

875021812224184323.text: A1 (2/2) @StartupChats_Canada Risks can be in the form of catastrophic events or systemic in nature (i.e. market, etc.) ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875021376293408768 …

875021717802020864.text: A1 (1/2) @StartupChats_Canada It’s identifying, assessing & prioritizing risk factors that can impact growth & biz success ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/875021376293408768 …

862350863561609217.text: A11 (2/2) @StartupChats_Canada Be eco-friendly (energy cost are highest), embrace technology & review expenses w/suppliers ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862350345481093120 …

862350651870859264.text: A11 (1/2) @StartupChats_Canada Look into association membership discounts, consider outsourcing opportunities (payroll) ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862350345481093120 …

862349340471414789.text: A10 @StartupChats_Canada Re-assess & ensure all predictions were accurate. Evaluate and revise the plan accordingly ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862349093405962240 …

862348193786417152.text: A9 @StartupChats_Canada This varies based on industry. The objective should be to turn a profit before industry average ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862347860502818816 …

862346986246344707.text: A8 (2/2) @StartupChats_Canada Every biz should predict when profit/goals will be achieved by estimating revenues & costs ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862346584880807936 …

862346916897619969.text: A8 (1/2) @StartupChats_Canada At the planning stage before starting out ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862346584880807936 …

862345707600179202.text: A7 (2/2) @StartupChats_Canada Remember to consider Fixed and Variable costs and efficiency gains as you scale ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862345302212317185 …

862345584358903808.text: A7 (1/2) @StartupChats_Canada Use projected income to estimate the time it will take for revenue to cover all costs ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862345302212317185 …

862344509325287425.text: A6 @StartupChats_Canada This varies by industry. Check the average for your industry & use that to gauge success ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862344229934297088 …

862344122497208320.text: Just 30 min left with @Scotiabank’s Laurent Mareschal discussing how to reduce startup costs & break even. Join us using #StartupChats.

862343112580100100.text: A5 @StartupChats_Canada Comparing actual results to projected; biz can identify concerns & develop cost reduction plans ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862342785797640192 …

862342389373046786.text: A4 (2/2) @StartupChats_Canada Be flexible to DIY opps (biz card design) & don’t aim for top of the line equip initially ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862341568338030597 …

862341825213997056.text: A4 (1/2) @StartupChats_Canada Trim operating costs: telecommunication (fierce competition) & energy (be eco-friendly) ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862341568338030597 …

862341049431228421.text: A3 (2/2) @StartupChats_Canada Research industry stats & look at competitor costs. Build in a buffer for unexpected costs ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862340366279860224 …

862340608890949632.text: A3 (1/2) @StartupChats_Canada The budget needs to be realistic & comprehensive; inclusive of all expenses ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862340366279860224 …

862340051711164416.text: A2 (3/3) @StartupChats_Canada Costs for a Sole Prop offering a service tend to be lower than Corps offering products ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862339073775730688 …

862339491717054464.text: A2 (2/3) @StartupChats_Canada Cost type and amount will depend on the business structure, size & nature of business ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862339073775730688 …

862339344073342976.text: A2 (1/3) @StartupChats_Canada Common costs include legal, research, marketing, licenses/permits, inventory, staffing ^LM #StartupChatshttps://twitter.com/Startup_Canada/status/862339073775730688 …

850391708076584961.text: A11 @Startup_Canada  Create a business plan & solicit advice from the trifecta: accountant, lawyer & banker ^LM #StartupChats

850390696246874114.text: A10 (2/2) @Startup_Canada  management models to assess credit capacity. A credit worthy biz is presumed to be healthier ^LM #StartupChats

850390544308203524.text: A10 (1/2) @Startup_Canada Meet with accountants regularly to assess business growth. Banks use financial analysis & risk ^LM #StartupChats

850389363758379010.text: A9 @Startup_Canada Sound advice from an accountant/banker, due diligence on clients & diversifying your business ^LM  #StartupChats

850389139874820096.text: Just 15 min left with @Scotiabank Laurent Mareschal discussing how to plan a healthy & profitable business. Join us using #StartupChats

850388228582629376.text: A8 (2/2) @Startup_Canada & later pay periods, create reserve funds & leverage the credit card 30d no interest pay period ^LM  #StartupChats

850388007303753728.text: A8 (1/2) @Startup_Canada Establish an efficient receivables strategy, use EFT to manage cash flow with quicker receipts ^LM #StartupChats

850386736438013952.text: A7 @Startup_Canada Gov’t sites, biz centres & specialists (lawyers, accountants & bankers) are all great resources ^LM #StartupChats

850385634636308484.text: A6 @Startup_Canada Leverage the business plan & conduct a quarterly review to see how initial projections compare ^LM  #StartupChats

850384375929765888.text: A5 (2/2) @Startup_Canada Is the business plan on track? Is my business heavily concentrated on one or a few customers? ^LM  #StartupChats

850384258342547456.text: A5 (1/2) @Startup_Canada Am I properly managing cash flow? At what pace am I growing? How do I rank against competition? ^LM  #StartupChats

850383672436039680.text: A4  (2/2) @Startup_Canada Most business plans are built by the owner, an accountant & lawyer. Help is never a bad idea ^LM  #StartupChats

850383241555169282.text: A4 (1/2)  @Startup_Canada Scotiabank offers a comprehensive business plan writer.... http://bit.ly/2oRpd19  ^LM  #StartupChats

850381832663293953.text: A3 (2/2) @Startup_Canada Conduct research to understand competition & challenges, for increased likelihood of success ^LM  #StartupChats

850381709984108549.text: A3 (1/2) @Startup_Canada Include qualitative (business vision) & quantitative (profit/loss projections) factors ^LM   #StartupChats

850380715166507008.text: A2 (2/2) @Startup_Canada Profit can be unhealthy if poor management practices are used and competition is ignored ^LM    #StartupChats

850380618789769216.text: A2 (1/2) @Startup_Canada Healthy businesses focus on creating long term profits, positive reputation & customer growth ^LM   #StartupChats

850379390462636033.text: A1 @Startup_Canada  Planning is fundamental for success! Helps to predict challenges & capitalize on opportunities ^LM  #StartupChats
